name: Zoloft
explanation: Zoloft (sertraline) is one of the most commonly prescribed SSRI antidepressants.

name: Lexapro
explanation: Lexapro (escitalopram) is an SSRI antidepressant used for anxiety and depression.

name: Prozac
explanation: Prozac (fluoxetine) was the first SSRI antidepressant, approved in 1987.

name: Wellbutrin
explanation: Wellbutrin (bupropion) is an atypical antidepressant that works differently from SSRIs.

name: Cymbalta
explanation: Cymbalta (duloxetine) is an SNRI antidepressant also used for chronic pain.

name: Effexor
explanation: Effexor (venlafaxine) is an SNRI antidepressant used for depression and anxiety disorders.

name: Celexa
explanation: Celexa (citalopram) is an SSRI antidepressant used for depression.

name: Paxil
explanation: Paxil (paroxetine) is an SSRI antidepressant used for depression and anxiety disorders.

name: Pristiq
explanation: Pristiq (desvenlafaxine) is an SNRI antidepressant, the active metabolite of Effexor.

name: Remeron
explanation: Remeron (mirtazapine) is a tetracyclic antidepressant that also helps with sleep.

name: Trintellix
explanation: Trintellix (vortioxetine) is an antidepressant with a multimodal mechanism of action.

name: Trazodone
explanation: Trazodone is an antidepressant often prescribed off-label for insomnia.

name: Abilify
explanation: Abilify (aripiprazole) is an atypical antipsychotic used to augment antidepressant treatment.

name: Seroquel
explanation: Seroquel (quetiapine) is an atypical antipsychotic used for bipolar disorder and depression.

name: Latuda
explanation: Latuda (lurasidone) is an atypical antipsychotic used for bipolar depression and schizophrenia.

name: Vraylar
explanation: Vraylar (cariprazine) is an atypical antipsychotic for bipolar disorder and schizophrenia.

name: Rexulti
explanation: Rexulti (brexpiprazole) is an atypical antipsychotic used to augment antidepressant treatment.

name: Viibryd
explanation: Viibryd (vilazodone) is an SSRI antidepressant with partial 5-HT1A agonist activity.

name: Geodon
explanation: Geodon (ziprasidone) is an atypical antipsychotic used for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

name: Lunesta
explanation: Lunesta (eszopiclone) is a sedative-hypnotic medication prescribed for insomnia.

name: Zyprexa
explanation: Zyprexa (olanzapine) is an atypical antipsychotic used for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

name: Klonopin
explanation: Klonopin (clonazepam) is a benzodiazepine used for anxiety and seizure disorders.

name: Thorazine
explanation: Thorazine (chlorpromazine) was the first major antipsychotic medication, approved in 1954.

name: Risperdal
explanation: Risperdal (risperidone) is an atypical antipsychotic used for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.

name: Nardil
explanation: Nardil (phenelzine) is an MAOI antidepressant requiring dietary restrictions.

name: Lamictal
explanation: Lamictal (lamotrigine) is a mood stabilizer used for bipolar disorder and epilepsy.

name: Invega
explanation: Invega (paliperidone) is an extended-release atypical antipsychotic for schizophrenia.

name: Picasso
explanation: Pablo Picasso was the legendary Cubist painter. Picasso is also Google's AI image generation model.

name: Warhol
explanation: Andy Warhol was the pop art icon. Various crypto/NFT platforms use the Warhol name.

name: Dali
explanation: Salvador Dalí was the surrealist master. DALL-E is OpenAI's image generation AI named after him.

name: Leonardo
explanation: Leonardo da Vinci was the Renaissance polymath, Leonardo.AI is an image generation platform, and he's a key ally in Assassin's Creed II and Brotherhood.

name: Michelangelo
explanation: Michelangelo was the Italian Renaissance sculptor of David and painter of the Sistine Chapel ceiling.

name: Raphael
explanation: Raphael was the Italian Renaissance master painter of the School of Athens.

name: Rembrandt
explanation: Rembrandt was the Dutch master of light and shadow. Also Adobe's AI lighting technology.

name: Monet
explanation: Claude Monet founded Impressionism. Monet is also a DeFi protocol.

name: Kandinsky
explanation: Wassily Kandinsky pioneered abstract art. Kandinsky is also Sberbank's AI image generation model.

name: Pollock
explanation: Jackson Pollock was the abstract expressionist famous for drip painting technique.

name: Banksy
explanation: Banksy is the anonymous British street artist. Various crypto/NFT projects use the name.

name: Rodin
explanation: Auguste Rodin was the French sculptor of 'The Thinker', considered father of modern sculpture.

name: Goya
explanation: Francisco Goya was the Spanish painter known for his dark period works.

name: Basquiat
explanation: Jean-Michel Basquiat was the neo-expressionist artist whose works are heavily traded as NFTs.

name: Escher
explanation: M.C. Escher created impossible architecture art, hugely influential in computer graphics.

name: Klimt
explanation: Gustav Klimt was the Austrian symbolist painter known for 'The Kiss' with gold leaf technique.

name: Vermeer
explanation: Johannes Vermeer was the Dutch Golden Age painter of 'Girl with a Pearl Earring'.

name: Caravaggio
explanation: Caravaggio was the Italian Baroque master known for dramatic chiaroscuro.

name: Degas
explanation: Edgar Degas was the French Impressionist famous for paintings of ballet dancers.

name: Bernini
explanation: Gian Lorenzo Bernini was the Italian Baroque sculptor of the Ecstasy of Saint Teresa.

name: Pascal
explanation: Blaise Pascal was a 17th-century philosopher and mathematician. Pascal is also a programming language designed by Niklaus Wirth.

name: Thales
explanation: Thales of Miletus was the first Greek philosopher. Thales Group is a major French defense and aerospace company.

name: Bacon
explanation: Francis Bacon was the father of empiricism. Bacon.js is a functional reactive programming library for JavaScript.

name: Kafka
explanation: Franz Kafka was the existentialist author of 'The Metamorphosis'. Apache Kafka is a distributed streaming platform.

name: Hemingway
explanation: Ernest Hemingway was the American novelist known for sparse prose. Hemingway Editor is a popular writing app.

name: Asimov
explanation: Isaac Asimov was the legendary sci-fi author of the Foundation series. Asimov Institute focuses on AI research.

name: Socrates
explanation: Socrates was the ancient Greek philosopher who developed the Socratic method, and a major character in Assassin's Creed Odyssey.

name: Plato
explanation: Plato was the ancient Greek philosopher who founded the Academy, and appears as a young man in Assassin's Creed Odyssey.

name: Aristotle
explanation: Aristotle was the ancient Greek philosopher who tutored Alexander the Great. Aristotle is also an AI company.

name: Descartes
explanation: René Descartes was the rationalist philosopher famous for 'I think, therefore I am' and his Meditations.

name: Nietzsche
explanation: Friedrich Nietzsche was the German philosopher who wrote Thus Spoke Zarathustra and declared 'God is dead'.

name: Kant
explanation: Immanuel Kant was the German philosopher who wrote the Critique of Pure Reason.

name: Hegel
explanation: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel was the German idealist philosopher known for dialectical reasoning.

name: Marx
explanation: Karl Marx was the philosopher who wrote Das Kapital and The Communist Manifesto with Engels.

name: Hume
explanation: David Hume was the Scottish empiricist philosopher known for skepticism about causation.

name: Locke
explanation: John Locke was the English philosopher whose ideas influenced liberal democracy and the US Constitution.

name: Hobbes
explanation: Thomas Hobbes was the philosopher who wrote Leviathan, arguing life without government is 'nasty, brutish, and short'.

name: Spinoza
explanation: Baruch Spinoza was the rationalist philosopher who argued God and Nature are the same substance.

name: Rousseau
explanation: Jean-Jacques Rousseau was the philosopher who wrote The Social Contract and influenced the French Revolution.

name: Voltaire
explanation: Voltaire was the French Enlightenment writer known for Candide and his satirical wit.

name: Kierkegaard
explanation: Søren Kierkegaard was the Danish philosopher considered the father of existentialism.

name: Sartre
explanation: Jean-Paul Sartre was the French existentialist who wrote Being and Nothingness and No Exit.

name: Camus
explanation: Albert Camus was the French-Algerian absurdist who wrote The Stranger and The Myth of Sisyphus.

name: Seneca
explanation: Seneca the Younger was a Roman Stoic philosopher and advisor to Emperor Nero.

name: Marcus Aurelius
explanation: Marcus Aurelius was the Roman Emperor and Stoic philosopher who wrote Meditations.

name: Epictetus
explanation: Epictetus was a Greek Stoic philosopher who was born a slave and taught that we control only our reactions.

name: Orwell
explanation: George Orwell was the British author of 1984 and Animal Farm, known for dystopian political fiction.

name: Huxley
explanation: Aldous Huxley was the British author of Brave New World, exploring a dystopia of pleasure and control.

name: Bradbury
explanation: Ray Bradbury was the American author of Fahrenheit 451 and The Martian Chronicles.

name: Verne
explanation: Jules Verne was the French 'Father of Science Fiction' who wrote Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea.

name: Lovecraft
explanation: H.P. Lovecraft created the Cthulhu Mythos. Many metal bands like Metallica reference his cosmic horror.

name: Poe
explanation: Edgar Allan Poe was the American master of macabre who wrote The Raven and The Tell-Tale Heart.

name: Dickens
explanation: Charles Dickens was the Victorian novelist who wrote A Tale of Two Cities and Oliver Twist.

name: Austen
explanation: Jane Austen was the English novelist known for Pride and Prejudice and Sense and Sensibility.

name: Dostoevsky
explanation: Fyodor Dostoevsky was the Russian author of Crime and Punishment and The Brothers Karamazov.

name: Tolstoy
explanation: Leo Tolstoy was the Russian author of War and Peace and Anna Karenina.

name: Twain
explanation: Mark Twain was the American humorist who wrote The Adventures of Tom Sawyer and Huckleberry Finn.

name: Shakespeare
explanation: William Shakespeare was the English playwright who wrote Hamlet, Macbeth, and Romeo and Juliet.

name: Homer
explanation: Homer was the ancient Greek poet who composed the Iliad and Odyssey, foundational works of Greek mythology.

name: Virgil
explanation: Virgil was the Roman poet who wrote the Aeneid, the epic of Rome's mythological founding.

name: Dante
explanation: Dante Alighieri wrote the Divine Comedy, drawing heavily on Greek and Roman mythology in his Inferno.

name: Milton
explanation: John Milton was the English poet who wrote Paradise Lost, the epic of Satan's fall from Heaven.

name: Chaucer
explanation: Geoffrey Chaucer was the medieval English poet who wrote The Canterbury Tales.

name: Goethe
explanation: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe was the German polymath who wrote Faust and The Sorrows of Young Werther.

name: Byron
explanation: Lord Byron was the Romantic poet known for Don Juan. Byron is also a brand of golf equipment and various products.

name: Shelley
explanation: Mary Shelley was the author of Frankenstein, considered the first science fiction novel.

name: Machiavelli
explanation: Niccolò Machiavelli was the political philosopher who wrote The Prince, and a major ally in Assassin's Creed Brotherhood.

name: Cleopatra
explanation: Cleopatra VII was the last pharaoh of ancient Egypt, and a major character in Assassin's Creed Origins.
